adjective.description: Chiefly Philosophy. Relating to faith or trust rather than to reason.

noun.description: Theology. A person whose belief is based on faith.

origin: Mid 17th century (in an earlier sense). From post-classical Latin pisticus, adjective designating nard (Vetus Latina, Vulgate) from Hellenistic Greek πιστικός (New Testament), perhaps genuine, pure, a sense of πιστικός faithful from ancient Greek πίστις faith + -ικός.
